items.title: Brazil's ex-President Bolsanaro ordered to serve 27-year prison sentence over coup plot
items.standfirst: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered former President Jair Bolsonaro to begin serving his 27-year prison sentence for plotting a military coup to overturn the country's 2022 election. The big picture: Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes requested that his order be finalized, preventing Bolsonaro…
items.content: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered former President Jair Bolsonaro to begin serving his 27-year prison sentence for plotting a military coup to overturn the country's 2022 election. The big picture: Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes requested that his order be finalized, preventing Bolsonaro…

items.title: Brazil's former President Jair Bolsonaro begins 27-year prison sentence for coup attempt
items.standfirst: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro on Tuesday started his 27-year prison sentence for leading a coup attempt, to the surprise of many in the South American nation who doubted he would ever end up behind bars. Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes, who has overseen the case, ruled Bolsonaro will remain in custody after being preemptively arrested on Saturday. FRANCE 24's Jan Onoszko reports from Rio de Janeiro.
items.content: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro on Tuesday started his 27-year prison sentence for leading a coup attempt, to the surprise of many in the South American nation who doubted he would ever end up behind bars. Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes, who has overseen the case, ruled Bolsonaro will remain in custody after being preemptively arrested on Saturday. FRANCE 24's Jan Onoszko reports from Rio de Janeiro.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro ordered to start 27-year prison term for plotting Brazil coup
items.standfirst: Ex-president to start serving term in 12 sq metre bedroom in police base in Brasília after time for appeals elapsesBrazil’s former president, Jair Bolsonaro, has been ordered to start serving his 27-year sentence in a 12 sq metre bedroom in a police base in the capital, Brasília, after his conviction for plotting a coup.The far-right populist, 70, who governed Latin America’s largest democracy from 2019 until 2022, was handed the punishment in September after the supreme court found him guilty of leading a criminal conspiracy to stop his leftwing rival, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, taking power. Continue reading...
items.content: Ex-president to start serving term in 12 sq metre bedroom in police base in Brasília after time for appeals elapsesBrazil’s former president, Jair Bolsonaro, has been ordered to start serving his 27-year sentence in a 12 sq metre bedroom in a police base in the capital, Brasília, after his conviction for plotting a coup.The far-right populist, 70, who governed Latin America’s largest democracy from 2019 until 2022, was handed the punishment in September after the supreme court found him guilty of leading a criminal conspiracy to stop his leftwing rival, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, taking power. Continue reading...

items.title: Brazil's ex-president Bolsonaro exhausts appeals, will serve 27-year sentence
items.standfirst: Brazil's Supreme Court on Tuesday concluded former President Jair Bolsonaro's coup plotting case after rejecting his appeal earlier this month. The court is expected to order Bolsonaro to serve a 27-year prison sentence.
items.content: Brazil's Supreme Court on Tuesday concluded former President Jair Bolsonaro's coup plotting case after rejecting his appeal earlier this month. The court is expected to order Bolsonaro to serve a 27-year prison sentence.

ai_summary: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro must begin a 27-year prison sentence.

items.title: US senators call for investigation of scam ads on Facebook and Instagram
items.standfirst: Hawley and Blumenthal cite Reuters reporting that Meta estimated platforms were involved in third of all US scamsUS senators Josh Hawley and Richard Blumenthal have asked the heads of the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to investigate revenue from ads on Facebook and Instagram that promote scams and banned goods.“The FTC and SEC should immediately open investigations and, if the reporting is accurate, pursue vigorous enforcement action where appropriate” to force Meta to disgorge profits, pay penalties and agree to cease running such advertisements, Hawley and Blumenthal wrote in a letter to the federal agencies. Continue reading...

bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, Bloomberg Technology

items.title: OpenAI Says ChatGPT Not to Blame in Teen’s Death by Suicide
OpenAI Says ChatGPT Not to Blame in Teen’s Death by Suicide
items.standfirst: OpenAI defended itself against a lawsuit accusing ChatGPT of coaching a 16-year-old to kill himself, saying the chatbot directed the teenager to seek help more than 100 times.
items.content: OpenAI defended itself against a lawsuit accusing ChatGPT of coaching a 16-year-old to kill himself, saying the chatbot directed the teenager to seek help more than 100 times.

ai_summary: OpenAI is defending itself against a lawsuit.
The lawsuit accuses ChatGPT of causing a teen's suicide.
OpenAI claims the chatbot directed the teen to seek help.
The chatbot reportedly gave the teen help over one hundred times.
The company is disputing the allegations in the lawsuit.

clusters.title: Zelenskyy ready to meet Trump to discuss Ukraine peace plan
clusters.neutral_headline: Zelenskyy Ready to Meet Trump to Discuss Peace Plan
bullet_summary: Reported by NBC World, France24

items.title: Zelenskyy ready to meet Trump to discuss Ukraine peace plan
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy told European leaders that talks in Geneva had produced a framework for peace to discuss with President Trump, but insisted there would need to be clear evidence that “Russia is serious about ending this war of aggression.”
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy told European leaders that talks in Geneva had produced a framework for peace to discuss with President Trump, but insisted there would need to be clear evidence that “Russia is serious about ending this war of aggression.”

items.title: Zelensky told allies 'ready to move forward' with US plan: speech copy
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky told allies Tuesday Kyiv was ready to "move forward" on a new "framework" of a US plan to end fighting with Russia but there were still "sensitive points" he wanted to discuss with Donald Trump.FRANCE 24's Yinka Oyetade speaks with Natia Seskuria, Associate Fellow at the Royal United Services Institute.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky told allies Tuesday Kyiv was ready to "move forward" on a new "framework" of a US plan to end fighting with Russia but there were still "sensitive points" he wanted to discuss with Donald Trump.FRANCE 24's Yinka Oyetade speaks with Natia Seskuria, Associate Fellow at the Royal United Services Institute.

ai_summary: Zelenskyy is ready to meet with Trump to discuss peace.
He told European leaders about a Geneva framework for peace.
Zelenskyy wants evidence of Russia's commitment to end the war.
The US plan is a framework to end fighting with Russia.
Zelenskyy wants to discuss sensitive points with Trump.

items.title: Four more arrested in €88 million Louvre jewel heist, Paris prosecutor says
items.standfirst: The Paris prosecutor announced four more arrests Tuesday in connection with the stunning heist at the Louvre Museum in October by a gang that made off with 88 million euros' worth of jewels. The loot hasn't been recovered. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.
items.content: The Paris prosecutor announced four more arrests Tuesday in connection with the stunning heist at the Louvre Museum in October by a gang that made off with 88 million euros' worth of jewels. The loot hasn't been recovered. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.

items.content: Emerald Maxwell has more.

items.content: Four more people were arrested Tuesday in connection with the Oct. 19 heist at the Louvre Museum, Paris prosecutors announced.

ai_summary: Paris police arrested three people for spying and propaganda.
They are suspected of promoting Russian war propaganda.
Four more arrests were made in the Louvre jewel heist.
The Louvre heist involved jewels worth 88 million euros.
The loot from the Louvre heist has not been recovered.

clusters.title: Ministers plan to scrap jury trials in England and Wales except for most serious cases
clusters.neutral_headline: Government Plans to Reduce Jury Trials in England and Wales
bullet_summary: Reported by Financial Times, BBC Top Stories

items.title: Ministers plan to scrap jury trials in England and Wales except for most serious cases
items.standfirst: Proposed changes unlikely to apply to trials for serious offences such as rape and murder
items.content: Proposed changes unlikely to apply to trials for serious offences such as rape and murder

items.title: Justice secretary wants to scrap jury trials except for most serious cases
items.standfirst: Only cases of alleged murder, rape or manslaughter will be decided by a jury under new proposals to cut court backlogs.
items.content: Only cases of alleged murder, rape or manslaughter will be decided by a jury under new proposals to cut court backlogs.

ai_summary: Ministers plan to scrap jury trials in England and Wales.
The changes would not apply to serious offenses.
Serious offenses include rape, murder, and manslaughter.
The proposals aim to cut court backlogs.
Only the most serious cases would have jury trials.

clusters.title: Daughter of ex-South African leader Zuma accused of luring men to fight in Russia-Ukraine war
clusters.neutral_headline: Zuma's Daughter Accused of Recruiting for Russia
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Guardian World

items.title: Daughter of ex-South African leader Zuma accused of luring men to fight in Russia-Ukraine war
items.standfirst: South African police are investigating claims that a daughter of ex-president Jacob Zuma was involved in recruiting men to join Russian mercenaries in the Ukraine war. The allegations against Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla claim Zuma-Sambudla and two other people were involved in recruiting 17 South Africans whom the presidency said this month it had been asked to rescue from Ukraine's war-ravaged Donbas region. FRANCE 24's Eunice Masson reports from Cape Town.
items.content: South African police are investigating claims that a daughter of ex-president Jacob Zuma was involved in recruiting men to join Russian mercenaries in the Ukraine war. The allegations against Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla claim Zuma-Sambudla and two other people were involved in recruiting 17 South Africans whom the presidency said this month it had been asked to rescue from Ukraine's war-ravaged Donbas region. FRANCE 24's Eunice Masson reports from Cape Town.

items.title: Jacob Zuma’s daughter accused of tricking men into fighting for Russia in Ukraine
items.standfirst: South African police investigate allegations made against Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla by another of ex-president’s daughtersEurope live – latest updatesSouth African police are investigating allegations that a daughter of the former president Jacob Zuma tricked men into fighting for Russia in Ukraine by telling them they were travelling to Russia for a paramilitary training course.Another of Zuma’s daughters, Nkosazana Zuma-Mncube, filed a police report on Saturday alleging that her sister Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla and two others, Siphokazi Xuma and Blessing Khoza, had recruited 17 men who are now trapped on the frontlines of the war in Ukraine. Continue reading...
items.content: South African police investigate allegations made against Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla by another of ex-president’s daughtersEurope live – latest updatesSouth African police are investigating allegations that a daughter of the former president Jacob Zuma tricked men into fighting for Russia in Ukraine by telling them they were travelling to Russia for a paramilitary training course.Another of Zuma’s daughters, Nkosazana Zuma-Mncube, filed a police report on Saturday alleging that her sister Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla and two others, Siphokazi Xuma and Blessing Khoza, had recruited 17 men who are now trapped on the frontlines of the war in Ukraine. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Jacob Zuma's daughter is accused of recruiting men.
She allegedly recruited men to fight in Ukraine.
The men were told they were going for training.
Another daughter filed a police report about the recruitment.
The police are investigating the allegations.

items.content: Four more arrests have been made by French police investigating the Louvre museum heist.

clusters.title: Flights cancelled as Ethiopian volcano erupts for first time in recorded history
clusters.neutral_headline: Ethiopian Volcano Erupts After Thousands of Years
bullet_summary: Reported by Sky News World, Guardian World

items.title: Flights cancelled as Ethiopian volcano erupts for first time in recorded history
items.standfirst: Flights have been cancelled over ash clouds from Hayli Gubbi, a long-dormant volcano in Ethiopia, erupted for the first time in recorded history.
items.content: Flights have been cancelled over ash clouds from Hayli Gubbi, a long-dormant volcano in Ethiopia, erupted for the first time in recorded history.

items.title: Ethiopian volcano erupts for first time in 12,000 years
items.standfirst: Ash clouds from Hayli Gubbi volcano sent drifting across the Red Sea toward Yemen and OmanA volcano in Ethiopia’s north-eastern region has erupted for the first time in nearly 12,000 years, sending thick plumes of smoke up to 9 miles (14km) into the sky, and across the Red Sea toward Yemen and Oman.The Hayli Gubbi volcano, located in Ethiopia’s Afar region about 500 miles north-east of Addis Ababa near the Eritrean border, erupted on Sunday for several hours. Continue reading...
items.content: Ash clouds from Hayli Gubbi volcano sent drifting across the Red Sea toward Yemen and OmanA volcano in Ethiopia’s north-eastern region has erupted for the first time in nearly 12,000 years, sending thick plumes of smoke up to 9 miles (14km) into the sky, and across the Red Sea toward Yemen and Oman.The Hayli Gubbi volcano, located in Ethiopia’s Afar region about 500 miles north-east of Addis Ababa near the Eritrean border, erupted on Sunday for several hours. Continue reading...

ai_summary: An Ethiopian volcano erupted for the first time in history.
The volcano is called Hayli Gubbi.
Flights were canceled due to ash clouds.
The ash clouds drifted towards Yemen and Oman.
The volcano is located in the Afar region.

clusters.title: Gaza aid operation blamed for string of deadly shootings to close down
clusters.neutral_headline: Gaza Aid Operation to Cease Operations
bullet_summary: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF), a controversial US and Israeli-backed aid distribution group, has said it will permanently cease operations
Reported by Sky News World, Guardian World

items.title: Gaza aid operation blamed for string of deadly shootings to close down
items.standfirst: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF), a controversial US and Israeli-backed aid distribution group, has said it will permanently cease operations.
items.content: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF), a controversial US and Israeli-backed aid distribution group, has said it will permanently cease operations.

items.title: US and Israel-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation to end operations in territory
items.standfirst: Four main food distribution sites operated by the opaque company had been flashpoints of deadly violence A controversial and secretive private company backed by the US and Israel that distributed food in Gaza has announced the end of its operations in the devastated territory.The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF), which had four food distribution sites that became flashpoints of chaos and deadly violence between May and October, said in a statement that it would shut down permanently, having “successfully completed its emergency mission”. Continue reading...
items.content: Four main food distribution sites operated by the opaque company had been flashpoints of deadly violence A controversial and secretive private company backed by the US and Israel that distributed food in Gaza has announced the end of its operations in the devastated territory.The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF), which had four food distribution sites that became flashpoints of chaos and deadly violence between May and October, said in a statement that it would shut down permanently, having “successfully completed its emergency mission”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation will cease operations.
The foundation is backed by the US and Israel.
The foundation distributed food in Gaza.
Four food distribution sites were flashpoints of violence.
The foundation said it completed its emergency mission.
